item.title: Hackers exploit WordPress plugin auth bypass hours after disclosure
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Hackers started exploiting a high-severity flaw that allows bypassing authentication in the OttoKit (formerly SureTriggers) plugin for WordPress just hours after public disclosure. [...]

item.title: Microsoft releases emergency update to fix Office 2016 crashes
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: ​Microsoft has released an out-of-band Office update to fix a known issue that caused Word, Excel, and Outlook to crash after installing the KB5002700 security update for Office 2016. [...]

item.title: OpenAI wants ChatGPT to 'know you over your life' with new Memory update
item.dc:creator: Mayank Parmar
item.description: OpenAI is giving ChatGPT's memory feature its biggest upgrade yet, allowing the AI to know you better by referencing all your past conversations. [...]

item.title: Microsoft: Licensing issue blocks Microsoft 365 Family for some users
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Microsoft is investigating a potential licensing issue blocking access to Microsoft 365 services for some customers with Family subscriptions. [...]

item.title: Claude copies ChatGPT with $200 Max plan, but users aren't happy
item.dc:creator: Mayank Parmar
item.description: Claude has a new subscription tier called "MAX," but it costs a whopping $200 per month, and users aren't happy with how the company enforces rate limits. [...]

item.title: Russian hackers attack Western military mission using malicious drive
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: The Russian state-backed hacking group Gamaredon (aka "Shuckworm") has been targeting a military mission of a Western country in Ukraine in attacks likely deployed from removable drives. [...]

item.title: Sensata Technologies hit by ransomware attack impacting operations
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Sensata Technologies (known as Sensata) has suffered a ransomware attack last weekend that encrypted parts of the company network and disrupted operations. [...]

item.title: Flipper Zero maker unveils ‘Busy Bar,’ a new ADHD productivity tool
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Flipper Devices, the company behind the popular Flipper Zero, has launched an open-source productivity tool called Busy Bar, designed to help reduce distractions for people with ADHD. [...]

item.title: ChatGPT's o4-mini, o4-mini-high and o3 spotted ahead of release
item.dc:creator: Mayank Parmar
item.description: OpenAI is preparing to launch as many as three new AI models, possibly called "o4-mini", "o4-mini-high" and "o3". [...]

item.title: Windows 11 tests sharing apps screen and files with Copilot AI
item.dc:creator: Mayank Parmar
item.description: Copilot on Windows 11 is testing OS-level integration that would allow you to share your favourite apps' screen with Copilot. [...]

item.title: Google takes on Cursor with Firebase Studio, its AI builder for vibe coding
item.dc:creator: Mayank Parmar
item.description: Google has quietly launched Firebase Studio, which is a cloud-based AI-powered integrated development environment that lets you build full-fledged apps using prompts. [...]

item.title: Hackers target SSRF bugs in EC2-hosted sites to steal AWS credentials
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: A targeted campaign exploited Server-Side Request Forgery (SSRF) vulnerabilities in websites hosted on AWS EC2 instances to extract EC2 Metadata, which could include Identity and Access Management (IAM) credentials from the IMDSv1 endpoint. [...]

item.title: Oracle says "obsolete servers" hacked, denies cloud breach
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Oracle finally confirmed in email notifications sent to customers that a hacker stole and leaked credentials that were stolen from what it described as "two obsolete servers." [...]
